column4: hi! I've got a problem... I had a wineversion from the winehq repo installed and "overinstalled" a version which I compiled by my self (due to a patch) but now I want apt to install the newer version from the repo again, but it doesn't work#
remove all the old wine references
not really? do I have to delete each single file?
I think it'll be faster to compile the newer version myself won't it?
thats your call, just remember your in this position because YOU broke the dependency tree, so you're welcome to carry on that way
how could I have not done it?
use the versions from the repo
package up the newer version against ubuntu deps
well... perhabs but there is a kernel error... I think I do have a problem...
you can't use the server release
okay... well that's not that good...
